result.execSummary:
All charges against Rashawn D Nelson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rashawn D Nelson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rashawn D Nelson in court, in custody. 22TR2132, and 22TR2133 are tracking with 22CF184 and will continue to track with the criminal case. Court recited the history of this case. The SPD office has not found anyone to represent the defendant. Defendant requested to be put in front of the judge to ask for a court appointed attorney at the counties expense. This will be set for Br. 1 to be heard in front of the Judge. Court and defendant agreed to find good cause to extend the time limits and set this in Br. 1. JA will set this hearing. 3:15 PM
to Produce Defendant 6/15/22 from Dane County Jail

3:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Rashawn D Nelson in court, in custody. Court addressed the motion filed by defendant. Reviewed the case history with defendant. ADA Lippert responded to the motion. Defendant would like to have an attorney present prior to having his preliminary hearing. Court found good cause to extend the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court will not dismiss this case. Recited defendants options for today. Clerk called SPD office. He does qualify, there are some conflicts with their office representing, they are trying to find an attorney to represent him unsure of how long this will take. Writ will be needed 4:19 PM 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
